title: Lee Smith (baseball)
summary: Lee Arthur Smith (born December 4, 1957) is an American former professional baseball pitcher who played 18 years in Major League Baseball (MLB) for eight teams. Serving mostly as a relief pitcher during his career, he was a dominant closer and held the major league record for career saves from 1993 until 2006, when Trevor Hoffman passed his total of 478.[1]  Smith was elected to the National Baseball Hall of Fame as part of the class of 2019 by the Today's Game Era Committee.
